page.title: 12RELIGION - CLAYBROOKE AREA
page.content: CHURCHES St. Peter's Church, Claybrooke Parva, with its Norman tower, serves the villages of Claybrooke Parva, Claybrooke Magna, and Ullesthorpe. St. Nicholas' Church at Frolesworth has the remains of medieval stained-glass in the east windows. CLERGY Rev. Stephen Haddelsey is the vicar for both churches and also for the small church at Wibtoft, St. Mary of the Assumption. CHAPEL In Claybrooke Magna is the remains of the chapel which was described in the Whites Directory of 1825 as 'a place of worship for the Baptists. It is now used as a store for machinery from the woodyard.
